data.title: Drew Sidora announces father’s death after battle with Alzheimer’s disease: ‘I was a daddy’s girl’
data.meta_description: "Real Housewives of Atlanta" star Drew Sidora announced Tuesday that her father, Dr. Robert Jordan, died following a battle with Alzheimer's disease.
data.text:
Drew Sidora is mourning the loss of her father, Dr. Robert Jordan.

The “Real Housewives of Atlanta” star announced on Instagram Tuesday that Dr. Jordan had died following a battle with Alzheimer’s disease.

“You’re never prepared for the inevitable, but here we are,” she captioned a video montage of special moments with her dad, who passed away on Aug. 11.

“It is with tears flowing, I announce that my father Dr. Robert A. Jordan has made his transition into Heaven,” she continued. “As my mom says, He fought a good fight and finished his race, with a smile on his face he picked up his crown at Heaven’s Gate!”

Sidora, 38, then thanked everyone for sharing their personal stories of caring for a loved one who has Alzheimer’s, a type of dementia that affects memory, thinking and behavior, per the Alzheimer’s Association.

“I was a Daddy’s Girl and I will cherish the precious memories that will forever live in my heart and his legacy lives forever!” she added.

The “Game” alum said that Dr. Jordan was “the best pediatrician in all of Chicago” and “was passionate about helping people, saving lives and providing quality healthcare to those in the indigent community.”

Sidora concluded her post by thanking everyone for their condolences and asking them to keep her family in their prayers as they continue to grieve.

“I thank God, knowing we will see you Daddy again!” she wrote.

Several Bravolebrities sent their condolences to Sidora in the comments section of her post.

“I’m praying for strength for you and your family. 🙏🏾,” co-star Kandi Burruss commented.

“😢😢😢 my prayers to your family during this time. 🙏🏾,” Kenya Moore added.

“Sending you and your family prayers and love 🤍🕊️,” “Real Housewives of Potomac” star Dr. Wendy Osefo wrote.

“I’m so sorry! I will Pray for you and your family 😞💔🙏🏾,” “RHOA” alum Porsha Williams said.

Shamea Morton told Sidora to let her know if there was anything she could do to help her and her family during this “difficult time,” while Dr. Contessa Metcalfe wrote, “❤️❤️❤️.”

In the midst of Sidora’s family tragedy, she is going through a divorce with her estranged husband, Ralph Pittman.

The “That’s So Raven” alum and the Call Me Daddy in the Kitchen founder both filed for divorce — 61 minutes apart — on Feb. 27 after nine years of marriage.

They share son Machai, 8, and daughter Aniya, 5. Sidora is also mom to 12-year-old son Josiah from a previous relationship.
